textBeforeTable: Granted, Spikes' 2013 stats don't leap off the page. However, the 26-year-old has been much more effective on the field than his numbers indicate, especially against the run. January 6, 2014 #Patriots placed LB Brandon Spikes on IR today with a knee injury. The hits keep coming— Ben Volin (@BenVolin) This time, it's inside linebacker Brandon Spikes whose season has come to an abrupt end, according to Ben Volin of The Boston Globe. Now, as the Patriots prepare to face the Indianapolis Colts in the divisional round, the loss of yet another starter on defense has them scrambling to plug yet another hole in the boat. The New England Patriots won their fifth straight AFC East title in 2013 despite a number of injuries to prominent contributors on both sides of the ball. Comments 73 Reads 16.3K Getty Images Use your ← → (arrow) keys to browse more stories
textAfterTable: Vince Wilfork DT Pro-Bowler from 2009-2012 Tommy Kelly DT 22 tackles, 2.5 sacks in 5 games in 2013 Per NFL.com The middle of the New England defense has been completely annihilated. Both starting defensive tackles have been lost for the year. Ditto for the top two linebackers. The injuries have shown on the field. The Patriots slipped all the way to 30th in the NFL in run defense (they ranked ninth in 2012) this season, allowing over 134 yards a game. Now the hole has gotten even bigger, and for all the talk of "next man up," the Patriots are running out of men. Share Tweet Fourth-year pro Dane Fletcher and youngster Jamie Collins will both see a lot more playing time with Spikes on the shelf. And while Collins has shown flashes during his rookie season, neither player received a positive grade in run defense from PFF. If there's any silver lining in this mess,
